bibdata.title: Remove extra library label from locations

comments.body:
In the checkin we said to remove the tmpl files and keep only the .rb files. After looking into this I rejected it as an option. I'm quoting my note from slack `I kept solid only the holding_library.tmpl file so that we don’t need to generate it every time.
I rejected the idea of using the .rb files that we generate through the #generate method because they are being generated by retrieving data from the tables. With that said every time you start lando and you generate the .rb files using the tables from the database the tables would be empty and the generated .rb files would be empty.  Unless you also call the alma api every time you start lando so that you populate the tables.  We don’t want to call the alma api every time we run the app in development or test. So it is better to keep the tmpl files and use them through the #generate_from_templates method so that we will create the .rb files locally in case they don’t exist`.
Also this Pr addresses the removal of the double label in the orangelight display and updates the Location::Holdings table in bibdata. It also improves the code by removing unused lines of code and the generation of a nil file. 

If we want to improve the way we generate the locations this should be part of a new issue.

dspace-development.title: Symplectic Elements deposits are failing for OAR users

comments.body:
Attempting to reproduce this with a test submission yielded the following logged activity:

```bash
2021-03-19 11:22:32,039 INFO  org.dspace.content.Item @ oar+symplectic@princeton.edu::create_item:item_id=15640
```

However, searching for Items with the ID 15640 yields no results for oar.princeton.edu. Please note that no errors were logged for this.

Querying for the Item within the database *does* yield results, so this may be related to a Solr indexing issue:

```bash
oar_prod_db=# select * from item where item_id='15640';
 item_id | submitter_id | in_archive | withdrawn | owning_collection |       last_modified        | discoverable
---------+--------------+------------+-----------+-------------------+----------------------------+--------------
   15640 |           43 | f          | f         |                   | 2021-03-19 11:22:49.683-04 | t
(1 row)
```

While there are `workflowitem` database records associated with this submission, they do not appear to be rendering for the UI. Please be aware that I have also attempted to update the `owning_collection` for this, but to no effect. I will proceed with this by trying to diagnose the root causes of the errors within the JPSUI theme.
Using the JRuby CLI, I cannot seem to load the Item using the underlying Java API, which would explain why this cannot resolve for end-users.

Evaluating the JSPUI theme, the `org.dspace.storage.rdbms.DatabaseManager` Class itself does not actually retrieve the results for the `Item`:

```bash
jruby-9.2.13.0 :008 > org.dspace.storage.rdbms.DatabaseManager.find(DSpace.context, 'item', 15640)
 => nil
```

...while this table does exist, with this row, in the production environment:

```bash
oar_prod_db=# select * from item where item_id='15640';
 item_id | submitter_id | in_archive | withdrawn | owning_collection |       last_modified        | discoverable
---------+--------------+------------+-----------+-------------------+----------------------------+--------------
   15640 |           43 | f          | f         |                21 | 2021-03-19 11:22:49.683-04 | t
(1 row)
```

Perhaps this is unrelated, but by chance I happened to have found that the directory-level permissions were adjusted for `/etc/hosting` on `gcp-oar-prod1`:

```
dspace@gcp-oar-prod1:~$ ls /etc/hosting/
ls: cannot access '/etc/hosting/dspace': Permission denied
ls: cannot access '/etc/hosting/common': Permission denied
ls: cannot access '/etc/hosting/example': Permission denied
ls: cannot access '/etc/hosting/dspace-multi': Permission denied
ls: cannot access '/etc/hosting/private': Permission denied
common  dspace  dspace-multi  example  private
dspace@gcp-oar-prod1:~$ ls -lt /etc/ | grep hosting
drw-r--r-- 8      755 dspace    4096 Aug  7  2020 hosting
```

After inspecting the database configuration for the DSpace installation, I located the following:
```bash
##### Database settings #####

# URL for connecting to database
# db.url = jdbc:postgresql://$GCP-POSTGRES-PROD1:5432/oar_prod_db
db.url = jdbc:postgresql://$UNKNOWN_HOST:5432/oar_prod_db
```

I updated this with the following change, and I could successfully access the Item in the OAR as expected:

```bash
##### Database settings #####

# URL for connecting to database
db.url = jdbc:postgresql://$GCP-POSTGRES-PROD1:5432/oar_prod_db
# db.url = jdbc:postgresql://$UNKNOWN_HOST:5432/oar_prod_db
```
I have just successfully tested this for the production environment with the new configuration update.

lib_jobs.title: Introduces formatting and linting using Prettier and ESLint
Introduces Jest for testing Vue Components
Implements separate ApplicationJobs for generating different AbIDs for those linked to ArchivesSpace records and those linked to MARC records

comments.body:
I apologize for the delay in addressing this, where I started to use this was really with the introduction of `AbsoluteIds::Repositories::ContainersController#search`. This was really used to provide validation functionality using the `fetch` API for the Vue AbID generation forms.

I have this disabled for the forms at the moment given that I had encountered severe performance issues when attempting to work with this in the staging environment. I can definitely approve of removing it for now, with the option of adding this validation feature for a future release.

lib_jobs.title: Implement Call Number (`Resource`) and Box Number (`Container`) form validation for AbsoluteIDs

comments.body: This was originally implemented using `ResourceController#search` and `ContainerController#search` actions, which received `POST` requests submitted using the `fetch` API.
This is...server side validation that the numbers aren't already taken?

Sorry, yes, this is for validation addressing the following conditions:

- The Call Number exists in ArchivesSpace as a `Resource`
- The Box Number exists (as an index for the `TopContainer` member of the `Resource`, or a node within the `Resource`/`ArchivalObject` hierarchy tree, e. g. for `2` this should exist as `current_resource.top_containers[2]` - if it is `nil` in this case, then the Box Number is invalid)
- The barcode being applied to the `TopContainer` is not already in use by another `TopContainer` (the ArchivesSpace REST API raises an error if this is the case)

orangelight.title: Updating requests to use the clancy endpoint for marquand

comments.body: Closing as this will be included with the recap close Sunday evening

We'd like to have a discussion about whether it would make sense to link out to alma's "library card" page instead of reimplementing this in blacklight. Arguments in favor of doing this are:

1. The local implementation requires 5 API calls to build the display page. Note that this is 1/5th of the concurrency limit for API calls.
2. There is functionality we cannot implement via the API, such as "renew all" (the api only provides single renewal, and again the concurrency limit) and up-front account limit notifications (e.g. "You can't renew this because you have too many fines" in the API is just "renewable: false")
3. Using the alma page would release developer time as we move toward go-live.

There are a few considerations we'd need to iron out:
1. What do we do with guest accounts? Provide them with usernames / passwords directly in Alma? Provide a minimal UI for them in blacklight (guests don't have as many privileges so this could be loans display only with one renewal at a time)? Just not provide an online account service?
2. Others?

Work for this issue is in progress on branch [2025-alma-account](https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/compare/2025-alma-account?expand=1). Setting aside / blocking for now until we get some feedback.

Clear division is needed when there are bioghist notes for multiple creators

comments.body:
Hmm, if I had to choose, I'd say maybe the horizontal rule? Would it be possible to add the name of the creator with whom the bioghist is associated as a header before the note? Also curious what @sdellis thinks. 

Wonder if this is something we'll be able to improve even more once we begin to review name record integration in the site generally?

We can associate the creator with the bioghist if we find an attribute tag to put in the bioghist in which to put the person it's in relation to in the EAD. I assume there's no way to do that in valid EAD? @regineheberlein ?
We had been doing this actually using the ptr element, but had to abandon it per the aspace migration.
That might be possible, I'll have to fiddle with the plugin again.
